content.prompt: Complete the method avgHairballsPerCat(int numHairballs, int numCats) in order to get the average number of hairballs that each cat spits up (you need to use integer division here, as 1.7 hairballs do not make much sense, right?). You'll need to handle an erroneous situation where there are no cats. (Hint: if there are no cats, what happens to your average calculation?)Implement try/catch to handle this situation:1. If the number of cats specified in the parameter numCats is 0, the method needs to catch an arithmetic error and return 0.
